FUSION ALONG TIME-DIMENSION TO INVESTIGATE ASPECTS
OF VISUAL PATTERN COMPLETION
Homayoun Navabi
University of Tarbiat-Modem
Tehran
navabi @lvcos.com
ABSTRACT
Image fusion along time dimension is
investigated to explain aspects of multi-sensors
visual patterns and the related representation
tasks. We address image fusion problem by
describing a layered complex channels neural
model. In processing visual data conventionally
complex channels utilize both the linear and
nonlinear operations, and consist of two stages
filtering. The first filtering is sensitive to higher
spatial frequencies than the second, and they
suppose to explain a number of imagiag task
complexities that can not be explained by simple
channels.
The work reported here focuses on practical
applications and behavior modeling to examine
new perspectives for complex processes at the
sensory vision that begins with antagonistic
decomposition of input. lhis is then followed by
fusion of emergent time-sensitive dita to
promote a non-linear dynamic association. Our
reported result suggests that time fusion $of data
in multi-staged complex channels of neural
processes exhibit the true adaptive behavior that
adjust itself to a changing environment.
